metadata.title: CVE-2017-11499 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: Node.js v4.0 through v4.8.3, all versions of v5.x, v6.0 through v6.11.0,v7.0 through v7.10.0, and v8.0 through v8.1.3 was susceptible to hashflooding remote DoS attacks as the HashTable seed was constant across agiven released version of Node.js. This was a result of building with V8snapshots enabled by default which caused the initially randomized seed tobe overwritten on startup.

criterions.comment: nodejs: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
